content: single_crochet each st = 6 st round 4 - single_crochet 2 increase 2 times single_crochet 2 = 8 st round 5 - 6 2 rnds - single_crochet each st = 8 st round 7 - single_crochet 3 increase 2 times single_crochet 3 = 10 st round 8 - 9 2 rnds - single_crochet each st = 10 st round 10 - single_crochet 4 increase 2 times single_crochet 4 = 12 st round 11 - single_crochet each st = 12 st round 12 - single_crochet 4 increase 3 times single_crochet 5 = 15 st round 13 - 14 2 rnds - single_crochet each st = 15 st round 15 - single_crochet 6 increase 3 times single_crochet 6 = 18 st round 16 - single_crochet each st = 18 st round 17 - single_crochet 7 increase 4 times single_crochet 7 = 22 st round 18 - single_crochet each st = 22 st fo - leave a long yarn tail to sew the tail to the body assembly - stuff the head and sew the head to body using the front loops of round 21 of the body stuff the muzzle and sew it to the head top of muzzle should be between round 11 - 12 of head center the crest on the head line the back edge of the crest up between round 1 - 2 of the head the sides of the crest should end between round 13- 14 of the head it is best to pin it in place and sew it on from the back side stuff the forehead horns and sew them to the head stuff the muzzle horn and sew it to the muzzle sew the belly patch to the front of the body stuff the arms sew arms closed and attach to round 19 of the body make sure the toes are facing out stuff the tail and sew it to the body the tail should be centered between the legs and the top of the tail should be on round 9 of the body congratulations your triceratops dinosaur doll is ready to meet the world terms of use you may use my pattern to make projects for yourself or others you may sell projects made using my pattern in limited numbers no mass production allowed when selling projects made using my pattern credit me as the designer if you want to share my pattern you may do so by sharing the link to my ravelry store https //www ravelry com/stores/mary-r-wilson-designs
